meanings.sent1: I tried some snush for the first time today.
meanings.sent2: He always carries a tin of snush in his pocket.
meanings.sent3: The old man's secret to a long life was his daily snush.
meanings.sent4: The snush was like a tiny pinch of flavor in his mouth.
meanings.sent5: The smell of snush lingered in the air.

meanings.sent1: She would snush the flowers to enjoy their fragrance.
meanings.sent2: The detective snushed the air for any clues.
meanings.sent3: The chef would snush the spices before adding them to the dish.
meanings.sent4: He snushed the fresh air into his lungs.
meanings.sent5: The baby would snush the blanket for comfort.

meanings.sent1: The cat would snush across the room when startled.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel snushed up the tree to escape the dog.
meanings.sent3: The kids would snush around the playground during recess.
meanings.sent4: The car snushed past us on the highway.
meanings.sent5: The wind snushed through the trees, making them sway.
